com.gui

Class FormValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gui.FormValidator

  • public class FormValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    FormValidator A validator for a specific form within the user window. Each type of form (saving a contact, saving a department, and creating a report, etc.) should have its own validator. The form validator will keep a list of errors in the form.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FormValidator() 
      FormValidator(java.awt.Color good, java.awt.Color bad)
      Form validator constructor for setting good and bad color feedback.

      • noEmptyFields

        public boolean noEmptyFields(javax.swing.JPanel currentTab)
        Asserts that there are no empty fields that are required
        Parameters:
        currentTab - Tab that is being validated
        Returns:
        Boolean: True if all fields are filled, false if there are required fields that are empty

      • validateName

        public boolean validateName(java.lang.String fieldName,
                   java.lang.String toCheckName)
        Asserts that the field value is not blank or equal to the default value
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Default value of the field being validated (Name of the field)
        toCheckName - Value that has been entered into the field to be checked
        Returns:
        Boolean: True if fields are valid, false if the field is not valid

      • validatePhone

        public boolean validatePhone(java.lang.String fieldName,
                    java.lang.String toCheckPhone)
        Validates the phone number entered
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Name of the field
        toCheckPhone - Phone number entered to be checked
        Returns:
        Boolean: True if phone number is valid, false if otherwise.

        public java.lang.String formatPhone(java.lang.String toFormatPhone)

      • validateDate

        public boolean validateDate(java.lang.String fieldName,
                   java.util.Date toCheckDate,
                   java.text.DateFormat format)
        Validates a specified date.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String name of the field that is being validated (eg. Contact Birthdate)
        toCheckDate - String representation of the date to be validated
        Returns:
        boolean; true if the date is valid

      • validateEmail

        public boolean validateEmail(java.lang.String fieldName,
                    java.lang.String toCheckEmail)
        Validates a specified email address.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String name of the field that is being validated (eg. Contact email)
        toCheckEmail - String representation of the email address to be validated
        Returns:
        boolean; true if the email address is valid

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if all form fields have valid input
        Returns:
        True if there are no errors saved for the form, false if there are one or more errors

      • valid

        public boolean valid()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        The typical method for validating a whole form. This method should be called when a form is to be submitted. If any errors are associated with the form, an exception detailing the error messages will be thrown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - All of the form errors are saved in the exception message

      • addError

        public void addError(java.lang.String message)
        Adds error message to list of errors in the form
        Parameters:
        message - Error message to be added

      • removeError

        public void removeError(java.lang.String message)
        Removes an error form the list of errors in the form
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be removed
